review_title: I enjoyed my time at Blue Wing
job_title: Retail Sales Consultant in Falmouth, England
pros:
I worked for Blue Wing while I as studying at Falmouth University last year.  I learned a lot and it was enjoyable experience for me.
This was only temporary role for 9 months for me and sadly I moved back home after. I hope I work for Blue Wing again if I go back to live in Cornwall.
cons: It was sometimes hard to focus on work during my exams but I have been supported by my supervisor and get through fine.

pros: Nice pieces of jewellery. Some nice customers. Some were regular customers.
cons: Owners did not care about staff or their customers. Money orientated. Had some very upset customers who had had poor feedback from owners or had no feedback at all over a few weeks. All shops have CCTV installed and you are monitored whilst the shops are open so you feel you are constantly being watched., even in the staff room(store room) Would not recommend anyone to work for them. High turnover of staff due to the way they were treated.

pros:
Jewellery is nice
Other members of staff in shops are nice and friendly
cons:
No breaks 
Staff areas need attention lots of mould
Management treat staff like dirt
Owners don’t care about staff
Some staff members are used and abused
Targets are not achievable 
Moaned at if you don’t get add ons
Watched on cctv all the time
If you are having a laugh you get phoned up and told to stop taking 
staff are not allowed to  get on with each other
Have to start 15 minutes prior to your start time and not get paid,,  if you leave 15 minutes earlier your pay will be deducted.

review_title: Enjoyable role for the right candidate
job_title: Store Manager in Saint Ives, Cornwall, South West England, England
pros: I have worked for the company for several years and very much enjoy my job. The products are great and the it's fun to work with customers helping them find what they are looking for. I enjoy being surrounded by such exciting pieces!
cons: Hours can be long during busy periods. You do need​to be self motivated and enthusiastic about the products and selling, you definitely get out what you put in!

pros:
Beautiful Jewellery
Lower management (not owners) were lovely
Seaside town beautiful
cons:
Management have massive trust issues
Constantly being watched on CCTV
Spoke to like children
I left in 2011 after the set up of a new store where we had to literally scrub the floor of the whole store with nail brushes
The owner is a control freak
You constantly feel on edge and even when you have done something well or sold something expensive you don't get praise for it

job_title: Sales Associate in St Ives, England
pros: Customers lovely stores bright customers nice
cons: Rude owners more training than needed. Does not listen to staff who have experience in  sales. I Targets unrealistic.  High turnover of staff no wonder. Negative vibes from owners. Beware you need to push add ins and products customers don’t really want. Bad refund policy staff not allowed to use there own discretion. No feedback after training. Terrible company Never in all my experience of working life have I ever come across such rude employers come into the shop and ignore you very bad.

review_title: Not a place to learn or grow in any career
pros: - I learned a lot about what NOT to do
cons:
-No organisation throughout company ie. structure or clear procedures
- Poor management skills  
- No employee benefits ie. social gatherings, learning opportunities
- Lack of trust and respect for employees 
- Not a positive or healthy environment
- No clarity or transparency in company 
- Lack of professionalism 
- No encouragement of teamwork 
- No confidence in team, not treated as professionals
- Lack of strong and positive leadership 
- No involvement in community, all about making money 
- Poor communication between employees and management, not provided with assessments or feedback

Owner should not be managing staff.
Training consisted of being given a manual to read through and no personal support
Constantly watched on cctv and told off for unnecessary things eg. not having door open in minus temperatures.
Every phone call from owner would be laced with negativity, blame on a low sales day and zero encouragement 
Strange mixture of stock all crammed together, hardly a gallery feel

pros: The were no pros working for this regime.
cons: Constantly being monitored by cameras, staff felt uncomfortable and paranoid. Source of jewellery questionable. Inspired and made my in Cornwall?????? Why is there no information on any of these artisans? Owner goes to trade shows.
